fields.description:
When adding any macro to a page and entering macro parameters in the macro browser, special characters (ä, ö, ü, é...) get corrupted. They display correctly for a short moment when inserting the macro, but upon re-editing the macro or saving the page, the encoding is messed up.
Screenshots show how to reproduce the bug with the info macro.
fields.summary: Special Characters in macro parameters get corrupted after saving with the macro browser

Thank you in advance.

See also [SUPPORT] (CSP-79324) Ability to search by tip title

Support format string for user name in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25138].
  {panel}

Hi there, currently we are running Confluence in Version 4.1.4, we have to implement a User Guidline Terms Acceptance upon the Logon Process. We've got to ideads in mind, on the one hand we need an additional Check Box on the LogIn Page with a Link to a PDF File , which contains the Guideline Terms, without checking it the user must not be able to log in, and there has to be something like a mark in the user directory set to each user who already accepted the guidlines; furthermore if the designated Administrator would update the PDF File, every user must accept the updated terms before being able to log in.

The other idea was , having a Wiki Page containing the Guidline to which every User is redirected after Logging in, to accept the Guidline in case of not accepting there must be a fall back to the log in screen.

Anyway , is it possible to hook up something like this?

ps.
I've attached a possible mockup
fields.summary: Adding Guidline Terms / User Terms Acceptance on the LogIn Page

fields.description:
When I am typing "jira" in the Confluence editor, it incorrectly capitalizes it to "JIRA". This is problematic as it makes my documentation incorrect.

I have jira (and application data) installed at 
* /usr/share/atlassian/jira 
* /var/atlassian/application-data/jira

and {color:red}not{color}
* /usr/share/atlassian/JIRA
* /var/atlassian/application-data/JIRA

While I understand the product's name is JIRA, this is not necessarily true for urls and file-system paths and should not be automatically renamed to an incorrect value.
fields.summary: Confluence editor incorrectly capitalizes jira to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Start up an instance of Confluence that uses wiki markup (e.g. version 3.5)
2. Add a link containing the ^ character to a page, e.g. [http://example.com&version=v^1.0] - you'll need to insert this link through the link macro or via wiki markup (cannot simply paste the link in the rich text view)
3. Upgrade the instance of Confluence to a version using storage format (i.e. 4.0+)

You'll find that the link you added is now rendered as plain text (and not recognised to be a link)

h3. Considerations
It's unclear whether this is actually a bug. As noted by [~pcurren], the [old RFC|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1738#page-3] explicitly disallows the ^ symbol, and the [updated RFC|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#appendix-B] doesn't include the character in either the reserved or unreserved sets of characters.
However, we should consider the impact of this behaviour for customers who are upgrading large instances that contain many links of this kind
fields.summary: When migrating from wiki markup to storage format, links containing ^ character are rendered as plain text

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page
2. Type " | | | | |" (note the preceding space)
3. Hit <Enter>

*Expected result:*
A table is created with 4 columns

*Actual result:*
Table is not created; five plain text (vertical bars/pipes) remain

The problem comes into play when there are preceding whitespaces accidentally injected, or loose whitespaces left from editing an existing document. These spaces can be hard to detect and clean up.
fields.summary: Cannot quick-create table if preceded by a loose whitespace

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page
2. Type the following
{code}
| <example> |
{code}
3. Hit <Enter>

*Expected result:*
A table is created, containing text '<example>'

*Actual result:*
A table is created, but empty
fields.summary: Cannot quick-create tables if contents contain tags (in angle brackets)

fields.description:
Running 4.2-beta3, the addition of the new Attachment Label feature is disturbing the layout of the Attachments View when files have multiple versions.

The columns are lined up correctly when there is only one version of a particular file, but when multiple versions of a file are uploaded and the triangle is selected to expand the revision list, the comments for the non-current revisions appear in the "labels" column and the remaining columns do not display correctly.

Luckily, the {attachments} macro itself renders correctly. It is only the built-in attachments view (viewpageattachments.action) that suffers this bug.

attachments-page-expanded.png shows the error in action. attachments-page-normal.png shows what the page looks like before expanding the triangle.

The complementary set of attachments-macro-*.png files show the view from the {attachments} macro. This works normally and I have included it only for reference.
fields.summary: The addition of file labels breaks the layout of Tools->Attachments View when files have multiple versions

fields.description:
Here is the reproduction procedure: 
# Create a page in the Test space called "original page", so we got the following link: "http://mymac:8110/display/TE/original+page"
# Create a new page called "mention page" in the same space by adding the wiki markup macro with the following code: 
{code}
[link:http://mymac:8110/display/TE/original+page]
{code}
# After saving the page, we can see that in the page information(viewinfo.action) for both of two pages, there is no incoming link/ outgoing link on either page. 

This issue can be workaround by using the link macro directly on the page without wiki markup macro, but this issue will affected the plugin who is still using the wiki markup. 

Please kindly review the issue.
fields.summary: The link in the wiki markup macro is not taking in the incoming / outcoming link

fields.description:
The notifications generated for pages containing emoticons or embedded images will include relative links instead of absolute links referring back to the server.

This is due to the DIFF output type not having a specific HrefEvaluator mapped in OutputTypeAwareHrefEvaluator. And since diffs could be viewed in the browser or included in a notification it perhaps isn't simply a case of creating an entry.

It is likely that inter-site links in the notifications will have the same problem.
fields.summary: URLs for emoticons and embedded images are relative in e-mail notifications
Allow administrators to disable 'change password' function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25115].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
* Start editing a page.
* Move the mouse pointer to any of the pulldown menu headers on the editor toolbar: Paragraph style, More colors, More formatting, Insert table, Insert.
* Press but do not release the mouse button.

Expected:
* The corresponding menu pops up.
* Moving the mouse with the button still pressed highlights the command currently under the mouse pointer.
* Releasing the mouse over a command activates that command and closes the menu.
* Releasing the mouse over the menu title leaves the menu open.
* For bonus points: Dragging over another menu header closes the original menu and opens the one corresponding to the new menu header.

Observed:
* The menu header button appears pressed down.
* Moving the mouse starts an image drag-and-drop operation.
* After the mouse has moved from the point where it was pressed, releasing the button does not open the menu, nor does any other useful action.

Basically, I want to be able to apply a command buried in a menu with one mouse action (drag from the menu button to the command) rather than two clicks (1. menu header, 2. command).

This also applies to other pulldown menus such as Browse and Me on the main page header, Add and Tools on the page actions toolbar, and other products (JIRA).
fields.summary: Editor toolbar: Menus should pop on mousedown, not on click

fields.description:
(!) note: I'm using opera browser

I'm trying to insert a new jira issue in my comment (not when editing the confluence page) on EAC and it seems I'm unable to click on "Login & Approve to retrieve data from JAC" button. Javascript issue, or what?

Steps to reproduce:
1) I log into EAC, go to [some page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1978016367] I can comment.
2) I click on comment field -> the RTE kicks in and expands
3) I choose from the comment toolbar "Insert +" -> "JIRA Issue", a dialog pop ups.
4) Blue "!https://extranet.atlassian.com/s/en_GB/3257/39c36334a8c693d872dc55efce9b7b07ed07f651.65/1.4.1/_/images/icons/lock_16_grey.png! +Login & Approve+ to retrieve data from JAC" appears. I'm not authorized on JAC so OAuth kicks in, that's why I see that message I presume.
5a) I hit on "Login & Approve" link - nothing happens.
5b) While I expected I'll be redirected to "Accept/Deny" page on JAC, as it happens when I'm inserting JIRA Issue when *editing page*, not comment.

My opera report an uncaught exception:

fields.description:
Chart macro will not render due to error
{noformat}
Error rendering macro 'chart' : org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 1 of document : Attribute "id" was already specified for element "h6". Nested exception: Attribute "id" was already specified for element "h6".
{noformat}

Relates to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-4813 
where duplicate id fields break the XML parser.

h3. Cause
This is caused by an included page in the Chart macro, where the included page contains headings. The headings are assigned an id tag when they are rendered, and the ids are consequently clashing.

h3. Workarounds
# Remove the headings from the included page
# Use the Excerpt Include macro instead of Include, as this strips formatting and as such will not throw the error.
fields.summary: Chart Macro breaking due to Attribute "id" was already specified for element

fields.description:
When you remove a table via Table toolbar > Remove Table button or a hotkey combo like Ctrl+z (i.e. if you just added a new table), the Table toolbar continues to appear at the top of the edit window. All the buttons in the Table toolbar appear grayed out, but they are still clickable and their actions still occur. 
For example, this was brought to my attention by a user who was using the Table toolbar's buttons within a {section} macro. 
User's steps:
1. The user added a wiki table via the UI and then removed it via Ctrl+z. 
2. Since the Table toolbar options were visible and selectable, he thought that he could add columns and rows to a {section} macro via the Table toolbar buttons. When he clicked Add Column, an actual column division appeared for him.
3. The user added content to the column and then clicked Save.
All his edits disappeared on save. He ended up losing all the work he did in the "column" that appeared in the {section}.

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in Confluence that results from the way third-party XML parsers are used in Confluence. This vulnerability allows an attacker to:

*    Execute denial of service attacks against the Confluence server, or
*    Read all local files readable to the system user under which Confluence runs.

The attacker does not need to have an account with the affected Confluence instance.

All versions of Confluence up to and including 4.1.9 are affected.

Full details of the severity, risks and vulnerability can be found in the *[Confluence Security Advisory 2012-05-17|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2012-05-17]*.
fields.summary: XML Vulnerability in Confluence

fields.description:
When including a page from another space, no suggestions are given if using the "KEY:Page name" (w/o quotes) format.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a space named "Resources" with key "RES" and a page called "glossary"
2. Create a space named "Testing" with key "TEST" with a page called "whatever"
3. Add the Include Page macro to TEST:whatever
- Start typing "RES:glos" in the "Page to Include" parameter (presuming it's gonna return "RES:Glossary", "Resources:Glossary", or just "Glossary" from the Resources namespace)
- ...but no results are returned ("Not Found")
- Unfortunately, dropping the key (RES will return all pages starting with "glos" with no obvious indication of what space it belongs to (unless you sequentially hover over every... single... one of them for the tooltip hint of what space it's in, and that could be a lot of hovering--especially if multiple spaces have pages called "Glossary")
- Even when you type the entire proper name of the page ("RES:Glossary") in the field, it will still say "Not Found", but if you continue anyway and save the page, everything works fine, and the RES:Glossary page is correctly included.

As a side note, it'd be cool if you guys just copied something similar to the UI of the Insert Link box, but instead changing the space dropdown to be a suggest-as-you-type input box (that way, you could type long-form space names in case you forget the short-form key, or just leave the space box blank for ALL, finding the pages across all spaces). Of course, that's wayyy more of a feature request, and for now I'd obviously be happy for the time being if it simply took the space key into account (i.e., the issue above).
fields.summary: Include Page macro not populating search suggestions when namespace keys are given

Bug tracking and project tracking for software development powered by Atlassian JIRA (v5.0#713-sha1:aec58e2) Report a problem

When using Crowd SSO, all other user directories are ignored and there is nothing in the UI that indicates this to the user.  There is a note in the setup documentation but this can be missed.  For example, this means once SSO is established the user will be confused as to why they can no longer login with a user from their internal directory (say the confluence internal administrator) as normally adding any other kind of user directory would not disable all others like the Crowd SSO entry does.

Possible ways to get around this when Crowd SSO is enabled

* Warn upon initial setup

fields.description:
Create a list that contains macros as some of its list items. Then try to "cut" a list item and paste it elsewhere. Depending on whether you use the arrow keys plus shift to select the item or the mouse you may cut the whole item including the macro, or you may cut the text out from inside the macro but leave the macro in place. It seems partially selecting the macro text helps cut the entire macro but selecting all of it will pull out the text from inside. 

Also, create 2 nested lists several levels deep. Cut some branch from one list and try to paste it into another list. The list structure will be lost in the paste operation.

Alternatively, in a different case cutting a list branch and pasting it elsewhere in the same list will lose an entire node of the original selection! This was reported in the wiki but I didn't see a JIRA issue for it and I was able to repro it so I thought I'd add it to this issue. See also: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=277252481#comment-277252481

We have many documents with deeply nested list structures that alternate between bullets and numbers. We frequently need to copy one of these documents and then massively reformat it. This was very efficient and precise with wiki markup, but in the new editor it is downright impossible because of these bugs and many more like them in the support of lists.
fields.summary: Cut and Paste inside Lists is broken in several ways

fields.description:
A customer pointed out the following scenario:
{quote}
Links to attachments located on Wiki pages include extra details in the URL, e.g. https://nw.wiki.com/download/attachments/716144722/Products.pptx?version=1&modificationDate=1327594360398 (namely the version number and modification date).

If someone copies such a link e.g. to send it to someone else but in the meantime the page owner uploads a newer version of the attachment, the link on the page will change - the version number and modification date will be different. After that the copied link still works, but it leads to an older version of the attachment, not to the latest one.

The simplest solution is to always remove the version and modification date parts from the copied URL before sending it, however it is not an obvious one. 
{quote}

Link of attachment in pages should not include version & modificationDate but instead use an absolute link.
fields.summary: Attachment links in pages does not get updated everytime user uploads the newer version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25036].
  {panel}

Legitimate use case:
Company X has a Very Large Directory (tm) which makes a synchronized LDAP directory hard to use.  They are using Delegated Authentication Directories w/ Copy Groups on First Login.

They hire person X.  Until person X logs in, they cannot be provisioned with any local groups by a Confluence admin.


Proposal:
Provide a button that would simply query LDAP for the CN's of all allowed users and create a user for each (with no groups or group copying).  This would solve the above use case gracefully (as they have no base groups, they will not consume license count), as well as be fairly performant, as a query for strictly CN should be fairly fast.
fields.summary: Create a method to "synchronize" a delegated auth directory on a case by case basis

fields.summary: Cache com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdMembershipDao.STRING_PARENT_CACHE already exists

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page. Type "This text is not in the section" at the top of the page.
2. Insert a section macro with a couple of columns inside it. Type "This is a column" in each column, and type "This is the section" at the very top of the section.
3. Save the page.

Too much whitespace will appear between "This is the section" and "This is a column".

Many thanks in advance for investigating.
fields.summary: too much whitespace above columns in a section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25033].
  {panel}

Fix this page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts

From John:
{quote}
Hi Sarah,

I added a quick note to this page but didn't want to start changing it all up before talking to you.

I hadn't realised before but on a Mac, most shortcuts in Safari only work with 'control +' not 'command +' as we've documented.

Chrome and Firefox work with both, so I thought perhaps we should inverse what we have now and put a note saying that for FF & Chrome that command will work, and then list all the shortcuts with 'control'.

What do you think?

Thanks,
John
{quote}

See also the JIRA docs: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts

Note to Sarah: Fix ff too
fields.summary: Fix the Confluence keyboard shortcut documentation
Option for "view change" link Recently Updated to diff more than one version apart

fields.description:
I've just installed the Team Calendar plugin on trial, and added my first calendar.

I get the following when trying to view the calendar:

"Unable to load events of PT Training (f90efbec-8ef7-4c86-a56b-e14652028284): . You may want to check the connection to LogicSpot JIRA"

No idea how to fix/debug this and not seeing much in Google about it.

fields.description:
Reproduce:
# Click Add > Page
# Enter some text for first paragraph
# Insert a table after that text

Result: There is no spacing between the text and the table. Looks bad with H1/H2 headings and their horizontal line (see attachment).
fields.summary: No spacing between page first paragraph and table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25029].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have Jira, Confluence, Crowd, Bamboo, Fisheye all running behind a reverse proxy (apache httpd). We would like to log the currently authenticated user in the logs of apache, instead of having 5 different tomcat valve logs with that information.

Would you please add this information in a response header - obviously, for simplicity, the same header name across all Atlassian apps would be welcome.

Thank you
--
Issa
fields.summary: Add authenticated user in http response headers for logging ability in reverse proxy

My guess is that there's a dirty transaction going on and the cwd_membership/row.  One transaction deletes data from the tables, and the other attempts to insert, but the row still exists in it's transaction that was created prior to the delete committing.

h3. Fix
Change the case of the username back to what it was in the source system. This must match the case in Confluence to avoid these sync issues.

h4. Workaround
Forcing a sync, or waiting for the automatic task, will restore the membership to the table as there is no longer a row to conflict with in the cwd_membership table.

h5. Secondary Workaround
If the preceding workaround does not work please try enacting the following steps to force remove all the of the groups.

1. Login to Confluence admin
2. Turn off naive DN matching
3. Perform full directory sync
4. Turned on naive DN matching
5. Perform full directory sync

Just installed on a clean\new VM yesterday.
Defined an Active Directory "Directory Service".
Sync kept showing "syncing 0s" or similar.
Still logged in as "admin", lost all permissions.
Logged out, can log in with AD accounts.
Logging in as AD "Administrator" or local "admin"... nothing has any rights within Confluence.
Clicking "Add new User" gives and error: 
"The following error(s) occurred: 
•You do not have permission to access /admin/users/browseusers.action. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.".
